item.description:
This is an loop style hike of lower-moderate to moderate difficulty. We will hike about 8.3 miles over a roughly 5 to 6.25 hour period on trail in scenic areas that include clifftops and along a gorge.

*** We had to change the hike to remove the Ice Caves loop as that section is closed currently (and the rest of the winter) due to significant icing and concerns of liability by the Nature Conservancy. ***

Our overall course will be roughly triangular with one far point being the lovely high Verkeerter Kill Falls (2.7 miles). Then we hike along interesting ledge and cliffs along the Verkeerter Kill to the the other corner of our loop at 'High Point.' There will be some ups and downs but not too bad. Overall an interesting trail.

If conditions are too severe (such as excessive icing or snow) we will shorten our hike to an out-and-back to Verkeerter Kill Falls in which case the distance will be 3.4 mi. over a roughly 4 hr. period. 

Those who wish to go should expect winter conditions and have:

REQUIERED:
* A daypack - to carry trail food, water, and any extra items
* Hiking boots - waterproofed as there may be some snow
* Dress warmly in layers - non-cotton, remove layers as get hotter
* Hat and gloves - may not need, carry in case 
* Rain shell or waterproof hiking coat - chance of rain/snow
* 2 quarts water
* Trail food - high energy, to resupply along the way
* Traction device available for ice very strongly recommended for safety as may be needed in places (MicroSpikes, YakTrax, etc.) 

RECOMMENDED:
* Gaters (or snow pants) - to keep legs dry if there is some snow.
* Hiking poles - to help with stability
* Whistle - to alert others if there is a problem

OPTIONAL:
* Headlamp (preferable) or flashlight - just in case
* Snowshoes - there may be some snow the night before, don't know how much, so may need in places - will keep posted on this

It may only be in the 30's and windy so dress warmly and in layers accordingly.

The meetup will be at 10:00 AM At Sam's Point Conservation Center parking lot ($10 parking fee per car). Get there as early as possible (opens at 9 AM) as parking is limited and no parking is allowed on the road (will be ticketed). We will hike in Sam's Point up the cliffs (1.0 mi.) and then a long hike (1.7 mi.) through The Badlands in the Pine Plains until we reach the top of the lovely Verkeerder Kill Falls. Then on the High Point Trail along ledge to the High Point feature at the end of the Verkeerter Kill (gorge) (5.4 mi.). Then we would retuen via the High Point Carriageway and part of the Loop Carriagway (which both tend to have puddles in places).

We would get back to the start and finish up 3:00 PM at the earliest to about 4:15 PM at the latest.

Dogs on leash are allowed.

 

Aproximate location/directions to Sam's Point Preserve Conservation Center parking lot, (Sams Point Rd., Cragsmoor, NY):
http://classic.mapquest.com/maps?name=Sams+Point&city=Pine+Bush&state=NY&country=US&latitude=41.672038&longitude=-74.358208&geocode=ADDRESS&id=14673987
[Lat=41.670572,Long=-74.360833]

Trail Map:
http://www.nature.org/photosmultimedia/samspointguidebw_911.pdf

Trail Map (topographical and much better but must buy from website or outlet):
New York - New Jersey Trail Conference's Trail Map #104, Shawangunk Trails-South 

Topographical Map (general, by Google Maps, to give an idea or the hiking area topography):
http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&hl=en&geocode=&q=http:%2F%2Fwww.nature.org%2Fplacesweprotect%2Fpreserve-map.xml&ie=UTF8&t=p&ll=41.675476,-74.36079&spn=0.019233,0.038538&z=14&source=embed 

Sam's Point Preserve by the Nature Conservancy (only a portion is on our hike):
http://www.nature.org/ourinitiatives/regions/northamerica/unitedstates/newyork/placesweprotect/easternnewyork/wherewework/eastern-sams-point-preserve.xml
Sam's Point hiking trails page:
http://www.nature.org/ourinitiatives/regions/northamerica/unitedstates/newyork/placesweprotect/easternnewyork/wherewework/sams-point-trail-and-hiking-information.xml 

Sam's Point Preserve more information from New York - New Jersey Trail Conference
http://www.nynjtc.org/park/sams-point-dwarf-pine-ridge-preserve?gclid=CMv8qtfzmq0CFQjd4AodV3fkmg 

The Open Space Institute (Creators of the Sam's Point Preserve and protecting over 20,000 acres in the Shawangunk Range):
http://www.osiny.org/

The Nature Conservancy (Manages Sam's Point Preserve for the OSI):
http://www.nature.org/

New York - New Jersey Trail Conference (Makes maps for, and works on conservation projects and trails in the area):
http://www.nynjtc.org/ 

 

=== Legal Stuff ===

By clicking on "Count Me In" or "Yes" or "Maybe" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows: In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.

group.name: The Hartford Area Hiking™ Meetup Group

item.name: Hike at Sam's Point and Verkeerder Kill Falls in Cragsmoor NY
